channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Lebanon mourns beloved artist Ziad Rahbani
item.description: Lebanon has lost one of its most beloved artists, the playwright and musician Ziad Rahbani.
item.content:encoded: Lebanon has lost one of its most beloved artists, the playwright and musician Ziad Rahbani.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Do conservatives have a role in challenging Trump's foreign policy?
item.description: NPR's Sarah McCammon talks to Kori Schake of the American Enterprise Institute, about her recent piece in Foreign Affairs, Dispensable Nation: America in a Post-American World.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sarah McCammon talks to Kori Schake of the American Enterprise Institute, about her recent piece in Foreign Affairs, Dispensable Nation: America in a Post-American World.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: What's it like to cover your own network when it is in the headlines?
item.description: NPR's David Folkenflik shares what it's been like covering President Trump's contentious relationship with the media, including public media and NPR itself.
item.content:encoded: NPR's David Folkenflik shares what it's been like covering President Trump's contentious relationship with the media, including public media and NPR itself.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 'From the Clinics to the Capitol' links anti-abortion movement to far-right extremism
item.description: NPR's Sarah McCammon speaks with Carol Mason about her new book, From the Clinics to the Capitol: How Opposing Abortion Became Insurrectionary.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sarah McCammon speaks with Carol Mason about her new book, From the Clinics to the Capitol: How Opposing Abortion Became Insurrectionary.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: In Gaza, more Palestinians are killed while waiting for food aid
item.description: Dozens of Palestinians were killed, many while waiting for food aid, amid a deepening starvation crisis and despite Israeli assurances of a humanitarian pause in some areas of the territory.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of Palestinians were killed, many while waiting for food aid, amid a deepening starvation crisis and despite Israeli assurances of a humanitarian pause in some areas of the territory.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Officials scour mountainous area for suspect in Montana bar shooting that killed 4
item.description: Authorities were scouring a mountainous area of western Montana for a military veteran who they say opened fire at a bar in the small town of Anaconda, killing four people.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities were scouring a mountainous area of western Montana for a military veteran who they say opened fire at a bar in the small town of Anaconda, killing four people.

(Image credit: Joseph Scheller)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Tea encouraged its users to spill. Then the app's data got leaked
item.description: A popular women's dating advice app suffered a major data breach, revealing users' drivers' licenses, messages and other sensitive information. The hack put a spotlight on the flaws in "whisper networks."
item.content:encoded:
A popular women's dating advice app suffered a major data breach, revealing users' drivers' licenses, messages and other sensitive information. The hack put a spotlight on the flaws in "whisper networks."

(Image credit: SOPA Images)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: A jury orders Tesla to pay more than $240 million in Autopilot crash
item.description: A Miami jury decided Tesla was partly responsible for a deadly 2019 crash in Florida involving its Autopilot driver assist technology. The automaker said it will appeal.
item.content:encoded:
A Miami jury decided Tesla was partly responsible for a deadly 2019 crash in Florida involving its Autopilot driver assist technology. The automaker said it will appeal.

(Image credit: David Fischer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: A little league heartbreak
item.description: The State Department denied one Venezuelan Little League team entry into the U.S., but allowed another. NPR's Scott Simon questions how the sports exemption to Trump's travel ban is being applied.
item.content:encoded:
The State Department denied one Venezuelan Little League team entry into the U.S., but allowed another. NPR's Scott Simon questions how the sports exemption to Trump's travel ban is being applied.

(Image credit: Dylan Buell)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: How surgeons build a new bladder for cancer patients like Deion Sanders
item.description: University of Colorado football coach Deion Sanders announced he got a new bladder this week as part of his cancer treatment. Here's how doctors construct a new bladder from a patient's small intestine.
item.content:encoded:
University of Colorado football coach Deion Sanders announced he got a new bladder this week as part of his cancer treatment. Here's how doctors construct a new bladder from a patient's small intestine.

(Image credit: AAron Ontiveroz/MediaNews Group)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden
